com.github.dm.jrt.stream

Class Streams

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.function.Functions
      • com.github.dm.jrt.stream.Streams

  • public class Streams
extends com.github.dm.jrt.function.Functions
    Utility class acting as a factory of stream output channels.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 11/26/2015.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Streams.RangeConsumer<OUT extends Comparable<OUT>>
      Consumer implementation generating a range of data.

      Returns a builder of streams blending the outputs coming from the specified ones.

      Returns an invocation factory, whose invocation instances employ the stream output channels, provided by the specified function, to process input data.
      The function should return a new instance each time it is called, starting from the passed one.

      Returns a factory of invocations grouping the input data in collections of the specified size.
      If the inputs complete and the last group length is less than the target size, the missing spaces will be filled with the specified placeholder instance.
      static <OUT> com.github.dm.jrt.ext.channel.ChannelsBuilder<? extends StreamChannel<List<? extends OUT>>> join(com.github.dm.jrt.channel.Channel.OutputChannel<?>... channels)
      Returns a builder of stream channels joining the data coming from the specified ones.
      An output will be generated only when at least one result is available for each channel.
      Note that the builder will successfully create only one stream channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

      static <AFTER extends Comparable<AFTER>> 
      Streams.RangeConsumer<AFTER>      		 range(AFTER start, AFTER end, com.github.dm.jrt.function.Function<AFTER,AFTER> increment)
      Returns a consumer generating the specified range of data.
      The generated data will start from the specified first one up to and including the specified last one, by computing each next element through the specified function.
      static Streams.RangeConsumer<? extends Number> range(Number start, Number end)
      Returns a consumer generating the specified range of data.
      The stream will generate a range of numbers up to and including the end element, by applying a default increment of +1 or -1 depending on the comparison between the first and the last element.
      static Streams.RangeConsumer<? extends Number> range(Number start, Number end, Number increment)
      Returns a consumer generating the specified range of data.
      The stream will generate a range of numbers by applying the specified increment up to and including the end element.
      static <OUT> com.github.dm.jrt.ext.channel.ChannelsBuilder<? extends StreamChannel<OUT>> repeat(com.github.dm.jrt.channel.Channel.OutputChannel<OUT> channel)
      Returns a builder of streams repeating the output data to any newly bound channel or consumer, thus effectively supporting binding of several output consumers.
      Note that the builder will successfully create only one stream channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.
      static <OUT> com.github.dm.jrt.ext.channel.ChannelsBuilder<? extends Map<Integer,StreamChannel<OUT>>> select(com.github.dm.jrt.channel.Channel.OutputChannel<? extends com.github.dm.jrt.ext.channel.Selectable<? extends OUT>> channel, int... indexes)
      Returns a builder of maps of stream channels returning the output data filtered by the specified indexes.
      Note that the builder will return the same map for the same inputs and equal configuration, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.
      static <OUT> com.github.dm.jrt.ext.channel.ChannelsBuilder<? extends Map<Integer,StreamChannel<OUT>>> select(com.github.dm.jrt.channel.Channel.OutputChannel<? extends com.github.dm.jrt.ext.channel.Selectable<? extends OUT>> channel, Iterable<Integer> indexes)
      Returns a builder of maps of stream channels returning the output data filtered by the specified indexes.

        Returns a builder of streams blending the outputs coming from the specified ones.
        Note that the builder will successfully create only one stream channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Throws:

      • factory

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> com.github.dm.jrt.invocation.InvocationFactory<IN,OUT> factory(@NotNull
                                                                              com.github.dm.jrt.function.Function<? super StreamChannel<IN>,? extends StreamChannel<? extends OUT>> function)
        Returns an invocation factory, whose invocation instances employ the stream output channels, provided by the specified function, to process input data.
        The function should return a new instance each time it is called, starting from the passed one.

        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the invocation factory.

      • groupBy

        @NotNull
public static <DATA> com.github.dm.jrt.invocation.InvocationFactory<DATA,List<DATA>> groupBy(int size)
        Returns a factory of invocations grouping the input data in collections of the specified size.

        Given a numeric sequence of inputs starting from 0, and a size of 3, the final output will be: 

             

         [(0, 1, 2), (3, 4, 5), ..., (N, N + 1)]
        Type Parameters:
        DATA - the data type.
        Parameters:
        size - the group size.
        Returns:
        the invocation factory.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the size is not positive.

      • groupBy

        @NotNull
public static <DATA> com.github.dm.jrt.invocation.InvocationFactory<DATA,List<DATA>> groupBy(int size,
                                                                                     @Nullable
                                                                                     DATA placeholder)
        Returns a factory of invocations grouping the input data in collections of the specified size.
        If the inputs complete and the last group length is less than the target size, the missing spaces will be filled with the specified placeholder instance.

        Given a numeric sequence of inputs starting from 0, and a size of 3, the final output will be: 

             

         [(0, 1, 2), (3, 4, 5), ..., (N, N + 1, PH)]
        Type Parameters:
        DATA - the data type.
        Parameters:
        size - the group size.
        placeholder - the placeholder object used to fill the missing data needed to reach the group size.
        Returns:
        the invocation factory.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the size is not positive.

      • join

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> com.github.dm.jrt.ext.channel.ChannelsBuilder<? extends StreamChannel<List<? extends OUT>>> join(@Nullable
                                                                                                             OUT placeholder,
                                                                                                             @NotNull
                                                                                                             Collection<? extends com.github.dm.jrt.channel.Channel.OutputChannel<? extends OUT>> channels)
        Returns a builder of stream channels joining the data coming from the specified ones.
        An output will be generated only when at least one result is available for each channel. Moreover, when all the output channels complete, the remaining outputs will be returned by filling the gaps with the specified placeholder instance, so that the generated list of data will always have the same size of the channel list.
        Note that the builder will successfully create only one stream channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        placeholder - the placeholder instance.
        channels - the collection of channels.
        Returns:
        the stream channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified collection is empty.
        See Also:
        Channels.join(Object, Collection)

                                                                                                             com.github.dm.jrt.channel.Channel.OutputChannel<?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of stream channels joining the data coming from the specified ones.
        An output will be generated only when at least one result is available for each channel. Moreover, when all the output channels complete, the remaining outputs will be returned by filling the gaps with the specified placeholder instance, so that the generated list of data will always have the same size of the channel list.
        Note that the builder will successfully create only one stream channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:

        channels - the array of channels.
        Returns:
        the stream channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        See Also:

      • lazyStreamOf

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> StreamChannel<OUT> lazyStreamOf(@NotNull
                                            com.github.dm.jrt.channel.Channel.OutputChannel<OUT> output)
        Builds and returns a new lazy stream channel generating the specified outputs.
        The stream will start producing results only when it is bound to another channel or an output consumer or when any of the read methods is invoked.

        Note that the output channel will be bound as a result of the call.

        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        output - the output channel returning the output data.
        Returns:
        the newly created stream instance.

      • limit

        @NotNull
public static <DATA> com.github.dm.jrt.invocation.InvocationFactory<DATA,DATA> limit(int count)
        Returns an factory of invocations passing at max the specified number of input data and discarding the following ones.

        Given a numeric sequence of inputs starting from 0, and a limit count of 5, the final output will be: 

             

         [0, 1, 2, 3, 4]
        Type Parameters:
        DATA - the data type.
        Parameters:
        count - the maximum number of data to pass.
        Returns:
        the invocation factory.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the count is negative.

        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the channels to merge.
        Returns:
        the selectable stream channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified collection is empty.
        See Also:
        Channels.merge(Collection)

      • range

        @NotNull
public static <AFTER extends Comparable<AFTER>> Streams.RangeConsumer<AFTER> range(@NotNull
                                                                           AFTER start,
                                                                           @NotNull
                                                                           AFTER end,
                                                                           @NotNull
                                                                           com.github.dm.jrt.function.Function<AFTER,AFTER> increment)
        Returns a consumer generating the specified range of data.
        The generated data will start from the specified first one up to and including the specified last one, by computing each next element through the specified function.
        Type Parameters:
        AFTER - the concatenation output type.
        Parameters:
        start - the first element of the range.
        end - the last element of the range.
        increment - the function incrementing the current element.
        Returns:
        the consumer instance.

      • range

        @NotNull
public static Streams.RangeConsumer<? extends Number> range(@NotNull
                                                    Number start,
                                                    @NotNull
                                                    Number end)
        Returns a consumer generating the specified range of data.
        The stream will generate a range of numbers up to and including the end element, by applying a default increment of +1 or -1 depending on the comparison between the first and the last element. That is, if the first element is less than the last, the increment will be +1. On the contrary, if the former is greater than the latter, the increment will be -1.
        Parameters:
        start - the first element of the range.
        end - the last element of the range.
        Returns:
        the consumer instance.

      • range

        @NotNull
public static Streams.RangeConsumer<? extends Number> range(@NotNull
                                                    Number start,
                                                    @NotNull
                                                    Number end,
                                                    @NotNull
                                                    Number increment)
        Returns a consumer generating the specified range of data.
        The stream will generate a range of numbers by applying the specified increment up to and including the end element.
        Parameters:
        start - the first element of the range.
        end - the last element of the range.
        increment - the increment to apply to the current element.
        Returns:
        the consumer instance.

                                                                                               com.github.dm.jrt.channel.Channel.OutputChannel<OUT> channel)

      • select

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> com.github.dm.jrt.ext.channel.ChannelsBuilder<? extends Map<Integer,StreamChannel<OUT>>> select(int startIndex,
                                                                                                            int rangeSize,
                                                                                                            @NotNull
                                                                                                            com.github.dm.jrt.channel.Channel.OutputChannel<? extends com.github.dm.jrt.ext.channel.Selectable<? extends OUT>> channel)
        Returns a builder of maps of stream channels returning the output data filtered by the specified indexes.
        Note that the builder will return the same map for the same inputs and equal configuration, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - the selectable start index.
        rangeSize - the size of the range of indexes (must be positive).
        channel - the selectable channel.
        Returns:
        the map of indexes and output channels builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified range size is negative or 0.
        See Also:
        com.github.dm.jrt.ext.channel.Channels#select(int, int, OutputChannel)

      • skip

        @NotNull
public static <DATA> com.github.dm.jrt.invocation.InvocationFactory<DATA,DATA> skip(int count)
        Returns an factory of invocations skipping the specified number of input data.

        Given a numeric sequence of inputs starting from 0, and a skip count of 5, the final output will be: 

             

         [5, 6, 7, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        DATA - the data type.
        Parameters:
        count - the number of data to skip.
        Returns:
        the invocation factory.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the count is negative.
